newsitem.title: USA: Cheesecake Factory sees unimpressive qtrs.
newsitem.headline: Cheesecake Factory sees unimpressive qtrs.

text.p: Cheesecake Factory Inc Chief Executive Dave Overton said Tuesday the restaurant chain will have "a couple of unimpressive" quarters amid high restaurant opening costs.

The high costs of a new Cheesecake baking facility and the amortization of the costs of new restaurants opened this year "will likely impact earnings per share by $0.13 to $0.15" in 1996, said Chief Financial Officer Gerald Deitchle.
In 1995 the company reported a profit of $8.6 million, or $0.80 per primary share, on sales of $117.2 million.
Overton told investors at the Montgomery Securities Investment Conference here that the company had been wrong in its estimates of the expenses and complexity of a new baking facility.
"Most of the estimates we thought were conservative turned out to be ambitious,' he said.
